text.text_translated: Some of today's adventurers are not happy with just one amazing trip, so they go from one challenge to another. Meagan McGrath from Canada, for example, has climbed the highest mountain on each continent, cycled across Canada and run a long-distance race in the Sahara Desert in 45ºC heat. However, her most special journey was probably a skiing trip to the South Pole, which is the most southern point on Earth. On the very first day, she fell into a glacier and had to be saved. Although many people would have stopped at that point, Meagan decided to continue. She reached the South Pole forty days later, after pulling a sledge with her tent and all her food through very cold weather and ice storms.
